function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through person-to-person contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proven treatment for covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased perceived risk due to closer psychological distance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proximity of temporal distance and spatial distance in relation to covid-19 increases psychological closeness and low construal, leading to a focus on immediate pandemic-related context and details.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fear of covid-19 transmission to families and friends due to close social distance within the in-group, leading to protective measures and enforced quarantine measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory quarantine measures leading to social isolation and potential mental health implications.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Implicit associations between proximate objects and low-level construal may affect judgment and decisions unconsciously, leading to potential misjudgments of contagion risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory may lead to underestimation of the severity and controllability of epidemics, potentially leading to complacency and lack of preparedness.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological distance and perception of low hypotheticality may lead to the perception of control over contagion, potentially leading to risky behavior and inadequate precautions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of psychological distance and its impact on contagious disease propagation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of construal levels leading to misaligned disease control strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider psychological distance in communication and public health messaging","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential tourists perceiving risks relative to the covid-19 outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of psychological distance and construal level theory on tourism behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact on the research context due to misinterpretation of psychological distance and perceived risk","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Losses in international tourism receipts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through human-to-human contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through human interaction in crowded areas such as corridors and rooms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on sensor-only estimation of people flow","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on estimation methods for building occupancy","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited applicability of the proposed method to large-scale buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate estimation of people flows and occupancies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of ground truth data for comparison","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Simulation software may not accurately reflect real-world situations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Identification problem in people flow modeling","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the state and measurement models","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on unknown parameters in people movement models for building occupancy estimation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to obtain real people flow data during emergency egress situations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Computational expense and potential stability issues in optimization-based people flow estimation methods","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Study funding without involvement in the study may raise questions about the independence and bias of the research findings.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete disclosure of the funding sources and the lack of involvement may lead to perceptions of conflict of interests or hidden agendas.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential influence of the funding bodies on the dissemination and interpretation of the research findings, despite lack of involvement in the study.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete investigation of shelter-in-place variables for covid-19 spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unintuitive associations between the built environment be attributes and infection spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association of built environment attributes with the spread of covid-19 in china","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection clusters in less dense areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in the associations of built
